Key Match Events: Bahrain scored an equalizer through Mohamed Marhoon in the 90+9th minute after referee Ahmed Al Kaf gave nine minutes of extra time instead of six minutes.
The referee from Oman gave six minutes of extra time in the second half, but instead, the match was allowed to end for nine minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Shin Tae-yong expressed disappointment about referee Ahmed Al Kaf's leadership during the match against Bahrain in the 2026 World Cup Qualification for the Asian Zone.
The Indonesian national team manager, Sumardji, even received a red card from the referee for protesting too loudly.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Indonesian national team received an additional 4.39 points in the FIFA ranking, but their position in the FIFA ranking has not changed, remaining in 129th position in the world.
Bahrain experienced a significant decline in FIFA's ranking, namely two positions, and dropped to 78th in the FIFA world ranking after losing 4.39 points.
Others: Ahmed Al Kaf has led 114 matches with a total of 343 yellow cards and ten red cards, and his appointment as the referee for the match was questioned due to his home country, Oman, being in the same football body as Bahrain.
